Row.Text: Welcome to our Lanfang Republic. My name is Luo Fangbo, and I speak for the communities here as their first elected President.
Welcome to the Lanfang kongsi republic. Although we are but simple mining communities, each man here has a voice to share with the world. Those voices call me their President, Luo Fangbo.
A pleasure to meet you. I'm President Luo Fangbo, and I speak for the people of the Lanfang Republic. Oh, are you interested in our system of government?
Ours will not be the last republic. Another will bear the sword of freedom in defiance of you.
So this is how liberty dies.
Welcome back to the republic.
Indeed.
I see.
Unlikely.
I will not.
Oh, welcome back. Today's assembly meeting has just concluded. How may I help you?
I see you've returned. Is this an official visit?
You are free to visit here as you wish. A pity such freedoms are not extended to your people.
Ah. Here to see what a functioning democracy looks like?
The communities are giving their all in the fight against you.
You're here, but have yet to give a reason.
You're a true friend of the republic. What can we discuss today?
Citizens the world over long to see you crushed. What do you want?
Welcome back. I hope you can peacefully resolve your current conflict.
It does not take a wise man to notice that your military is poised to strike.
Are you performing military drills? Cast your swords into picks, and instead work to better your communities.
Greed consumes the land, including that which we intend to mine. I do not wish to resort to violence.
I see you are expanding as well, seeking mining opportunities. We should negotiate a compromise, before this escalates.
Invest in improving your shoddy lands. Don't waste time expanding.
You may wish to consider buying infrastructure, rather than more territory.
A strong defense force is an important tool of any country. You should be proud of your military.
An economy worthy of a wise ruler. Perhaps you're here to discuss trade?
Without workable land your people will grow poor and starve. Settle more cities, or don't.
No country can survive undefended. It is simply the way of the world.
Your ways are brutish and uncivilized. We always have more to gain through co-operation than conquest.
Would you consider making a joint Declaration of Friendship? I believe our countries have a bright future together.
Neither of our countries may stand alone in this world. What do you think of making a Declaration of Friendship?
Lanfang is seeking to position itself among the better nations of the world. To this end, may we consider ourselves your friends?
I hope some day we can formally become friends. Until then.
Let us work together, first. Then we will know if this suits our interests.
The world is moving beyond violent empires like {1_CivName}. We should denounce this relic together.
I have no time for greedy empires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
The republic stands against you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
You may denounce us if you wish. Nothing will come of it.
Well? Anything else? Or are you simply here to shout and thump your chest?
It is wonderful to hear that you have befriended {1_CivName}. Let us carry the torch of freedom together.
You may find {1_CivName} a troublesome partner. I suggest you keep them at arm's length.
{1_CivName} are reliable allies of ours. Can't you see past your differences?
All those who believe in freedom must oppose {1_CivName}. I am glad to see you feel the same.
I dream of a world where nations may work together in peace. To that end, I too have befriended {1_CivName}.
We have been greatly concerned by the actions of {1_CivName} for some time. I shall follow your lead in denouncing them.
I can judge {1_CivName} by the company they keep. The Lanfang Republic hereby denounces them.
You scowl and shout at {1_CivName}, but you will not shake the resolve of the democratic world. We offer them our support.
Do you at last bring war to Lanfang? Be warned; we are prepared to face you with everything we have.
Villages have reported a buildup of your troops close to our border. I must ask you to withdraw and avoid any escalation.
Your core cities starve as you expand recklessly. Focus on your infrastructure, before your people overthrow their foolish leader.
We should negotiate for territorial rights, instead of simply wandering about planting flags. Please consult us next time you wish to settle near our border.
You should consider channeling your taxpayer's capital into rebuiliding your society. It is in a pitiful state.
Your people work hard; they expect money for infrastructure and services. Why do you waste their gold on pointless claims?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} rears their ugly head at the democratic world. We must stop them together.
Lanfang intends to launch defensive countermeasures against {1_PlayerName:textkey}'s aggression. Can we count on your assistance?
We have been pushed too far by {1_PlayerName:textkey}. It is time we defend ourselves - together.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} are well on their way to becoming full members of the kongsi. I would ask that you not deny them that chance.
I apologize.
Very well. We will seek mining opportunities elsewhere.
Forgive me, but it is essential that Lanfang explore new mining opportunities.
I couldn't help but notice how pathetic you are. And when I realized it I couldn't help but share.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
I thought you might like to know that your army is a little on the weak side. Better watch your back.
With an army so weak it's a surprise your empire hasn't succumb to a barbarian invasion.
Our words are backed with nuclear weapons!
It's a shame there are some leaders in this world who have their fun by picking on the weak. Don't you agree?
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It's come to my attention that your empire appears to be quite puny. Did you forget to expand your borders or are you just having a little trouble with that?
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
What a sad sight... your empire is so uncultured. What do your citizens do all day, beat rocks together?
Rumor has it that your culture is so laughable that even the barbarians are shying away from your lands.
We struck upon this while scouting out new mining locations. We can conduct a trade, if you are interested.
I believe there is no need to restrict the freedom of our people to travel as they please.
I believe in positive trade agreements. Please let me know if you come up with one.
This will need to be distributed to all our communities - could we ask for a higher quantity in exchange?
I am trying my best to accomodate you, but I must ask for more.
The republic is prepared to face you.
Then we shall face you down. Democracy will win the day, as it always has.
I see it was foolish to engage with you.
You may find the fire of democracy rather difficult to extinguish.
I'm sorry that it has come to this. We are not a belligerent people, but our interests must be protected!
Your people cry out for liberation. We can no longer ignore their pleas.
As we have been unable to settle our land issues peacefully, I regretfully declare our nations to be in a state of war.
I will not allow Lanfang to suffocate under your reckless expansion. We will seize back our mines!
That is unfortunate. I did not wish to go to war with you.
Peace will come, but I do not yet know the form it will take.
We must strengthen our position before negotiating peace.
Are you quite mad?
Our people are now electing their leaders and establishing mining communities. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are electing their leaders and establishing mining communities. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
